content: 30 minute warning for our meeting

starting with action item review
https://hackmd.io/UrERZvi5RwyxfGvo-RtC6g?both
still finishing up the blog post

but it's almost done and ready for review and publish
I did go ahead and create tracking issues for a few action items that have been sitting around for a while
though all of those are low priority ideas that we shouldn't worry too much about in the near term
since I think we're already more or less working at capacity and don't need to pick up more work right now
but I wanted to make sure the ideas don't get lost

which is coming along nicely

I haven't gotten around to any of that since the last meeting, with job interviews and other life stuff
I think @Jakub Duchniewicz and I figured out the error for the rust-sv crate
so I'm going to go ahead and mark that one done
@DPC are you still planning on updating the tracking issue for the "Fix the error trait" issue?
not sure if DPC is here today so I'll keep going and they can reply later when they're around
ask libs / lang teams for recommendations on including 3rd party libraries in our book
so I went ahead and created a zulip topic for this
the conclusion was that we're more or less okay with mentioning 3rd party libraries in the book
here is the relevant thread https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/219381-t-libs/topic/3rd.20party.20libraries.20in.20official.20books.2Fdocumentation
I'll go ahead and make an action item for summarizing the discussion into a plan going forward
Jakub is working on the termination trait stabilization
and that seems to be going well
oliver has been busy lately but has triaged a bunch of potential issues for us
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
That's all I've got for the existing action items, so lets move onto those triage issues

• (low priority) https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/80846
  • (out of scope) https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/syntax-for-returning-early-with-an-error/14181
  • (out of scope, superceded by try trait v2) https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144729-wg-traits/topic/specialization.3A.20exclude.20traits.20or.20types/near/229141547
  • https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/146212-t-compiler.2Fconst-eval/topic/static_assert.20for.20const.20generics/near/229109938
I took a look at these before hte meeting
the first one is an issue about differences between std::panic! and core::panic! behaviour
I more or less agree with Mara on this one
the issue is already an edge case that most people don't encounter or complain about and its been fixed in 2021
so I think we should focus on more important issues, particularly getting dyn Error integrated with panics
the second issue is a forum thread about try syntax
which is a lang team concern and is explicitly out of scope for PG-Error-Handling according to our charter
so I don't think we should get involved
the 3rd one is a thread about negative trait bounds

my understanding is that negative trait bounds wouldn't work well with the rest of our trait solving engine and would make it undecidable, which is why the lang team is working on specialization instead

and the specific issue they bring up, overlap on From impls for catch all error types is already potentially resolved by the new Try trait RFC, which makes it possible to handle the From impl as part of the Try type that wraps the catch all error, freeing it from overlap
this is covered in my blog post
so I also don't think we should bother pursuing negative reasoning to fix this issue
the last one is a diagnostic issue within the compiler

we can absolutely help with it if they would like our help, though I'm not sure we should be spending time with error handling implementation details, particularly within the compiler where they don't rely as much on the Error trait interface.
I'll leave it up to @oli if he would like us to jump in and help out
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
I think that's it for what I wanted to talk about, does anyone else have something they would like to bring up?
Still working on the graphic display
Nothing on my end
alrighty
I think we can call this meeting early then
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.

my to-do list currently has:

- update API guidelines to add a section on implementing Display vs source
- create an issue tracking the desire for an aborting interface for panics
- create an issue for a non-allocating interface for printing Backtrace
- implement Iterator trait on Frames type from backtrace frames PR
- error design patterns book
- writing
- reference review
- reading group
- review open issues for those related to error handling
- fix the error trait
- collect references into the GitHub repo

But I think I need to revisit some of these
the 2nd and 3rd ones are already done
so you can take those off of your todo list

Fixing the Error Trait currently has:

- do some more work on the formatting implementations
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/71706
- review remaining questions on Debug formatting
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/65280
the formatting implementatoins for the error trait are already in a good spot afaik
might the related issues be closed?
and the plan was to update the checklist to indicate that we no longer plan on implementing the precision suggestion
or that it can be done separately
and @Ashley Mannix already fixed the inconsistency in backtrace formatting
